html: HISTORY Making Day: With the passage of #HR1, the US House of Representatives today officially endorsed #DCstatehood for the first time in American history. This vote sets the stage for consideration of HR 51, the Washington, D.C. Admission Act, which already has 200 cosponsors.
text:
HISTORY Making Day: With the passage of #HR1, the US House of Representatives today officially endorsed #DCstatehood for the first time in American history.

This vote sets the stage for consideration of HR 51, the Washington, D.C. Admission Act, which already has 200 cosponsors.

html: Took seven votes today on the House floor, the most yet. Many more to go to make up for 218 years without a vote.

html: It is outrageous that only the President can grant clemency for local DC offenses. DC writes its own laws and alone should grant clemency from those laws, like states and territories. My bill gives DC that authority. #FreeAndEqualDC

DC writes its own laws and alone should grant clemency from those laws, like states and territories. My bill gives DC that authority. #FreeAndEqualDC

html: I supported the House vote this week to remove US troops from Yemen. Yet DC had no vote on this matter of war and peace, even though DC residents fund, fight and die in wars. DC deserves a vote on wars and all other matters. My #DCStatehood bill would fix this injustice.
text: I supported the House vote this week to remove US troops from Yemen.  Yet DC had no vote on this matter of war and peace, even though DC residents fund, fight and die in wars.  DC deserves a vote on wars and all other matters.  My #DCStatehood bill would fix this injustice.

html: Good news for DC - Final FY 19 DC spending bill contains $40 million for DCTAG for the 4th consecutive year and no new anti-home-rule riders! Now that we have a Democratic House, we will redouble our efforts to remove the remaining two riders in FY 20.

html: Correct the record Sen. Cruz: 1) your amendment doesn’t block only fed funds from being used to implement DC’s health insurance mandate—it blocks local DC funds too 2) DC's mandate wasn’t “quietly” passed—it was debated and approved twice by LOCALLY elected officials #HandsOffDChttps://twitter.com/SenTedCruz/status/1021781708532850688 …
text:
Correct the record Sen. Cruz:
1) your amendment doesn’t block only fed funds from being used to implement DC’s health insurance mandate—it blocks local DC funds too

2) DC's mandate wasn’t “quietly” passed—it was debated and approved twice by LOCALLY elected officials #HandsOffDChttps://twitter.com/SenTedCruz/status/1021781708532850688 …

text:
Just testified to put “National” in Rock Creek Park’s name—which will help me get public and private funding for the park.

text:
LET’S CELEBRATE! 

The 2018 #StanleyCup Championship Parade is Tues., June 12 and begins at 11 a.m. at Constitution Ave. and 17th St. NW and proceed along Constitution Ave. to 7th St. NW where it will turn right and culminate in an #ALLCAPS rally at 7th St. NW and National Mall.

html: I’m introducing a congressional resolution designating 2018 the Year of the Anacostia River. 4 of my enacted bills are contributing to the river’s cleanup, and I get millions in federal funds each year for cleanup. My aim: Erase the moniker “forgotten river” from the Anacostia.
text: I’m introducing a congressional resolution designating 2018 the Year of the Anacostia River. 4 of my enacted bills are contributing to the river’s cleanup, and I get millions in federal funds each year for cleanup. My aim: Erase the moniker “forgotten river” from the Anacostia.

html: When DC’s mayor lacks the authority to deploy the DC National Guard for local purposes, such as natural disasters, not only DC residents are at risk, but so are Members of Congress and DC visitors because of the slow reaction time to get authorization from the President.
text: When DC’s mayor lacks the authority to deploy the DC National Guard for local purposes, such as natural disasters, not only DC residents are at risk, but so are Members of Congress and DC visitors because of the slow reaction time to get authorization from the President.

html: I've filed an amendment to give DC's mayor local authority over DC's National Guard, the same authority enjoyed by governors of states and territories. DC's mayor has the best knowledge about when to deploy the Guard for local purposes, such as natural disasters. #FreeandEqualDC
text: I've filed an amendment to give DC's mayor local authority over DC's National Guard, the same authority enjoyed by governors of states and territories. DC's mayor has the best knowledge about when to deploy the Guard for local purposes, such as natural disasters. #FreeandEqualDC

html: Join us on Monday at 11:30am as we plant a DC tree on Capitol Grounds in recognition of DC residents, who live the nation’s capital without voting rights in Congress. Pending #DCStatehood, DC deserves the same recognition, small or large, as the 50 states. https://norton.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/norton-to-speak-at-planting-of-dc-tree-on-capitol-grounds-in-recognition …pic.twitter.com/BnL14kE4o3
